detaileddescription.para: Default: use the generic graphics data field, or no colouring if none
Use the magnitude of the stream vector field. More efficient than using a separate magnitude field since already computed in algorithm.
Integrate time along the streamline to show how long it took to reach a point and how long each bit takes. Negated for reverse track direction
Streamlines graphics algorithm specific methods for colouring by data.
the reverse of stream_vector_field is tracked
Enumeration giving the direction streamlines are tracked relative to the stream vector field.
Return the C handle of the derived GraphicsStreamlines object.

simplesect.para: C handle of the derived GraphicsStreamlines if this objects is valid, 0 otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Gets the type of data visualised with spectrum colour on the streamlines.

simplesect.para: The current data type for colouring, or DATA_TYPE_INVALID on error.

detaileddescription.para:
Sets the type of data visualised with spectrum colour on the streamlines, including algorithm-specific types such as TRAVEL_TIME, as well as colouring by the generic graphics data field. Spectrum must be set for any colouring.
GraphicsStreamlines::ColourDataType
Status CMLibs::Zinc::OK on success, otherwise CMLibs::Zinc::ERROR_ARGUMENT.
Gets the vector field the streamline is tracking along.

simplesect.para: Handle to stream vector field, or NULL/invalid handle if none or failed.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the vector field to track the streamline along. For a 3-D domain with a 3-D coordinate field, can have 3, 6 or 9 components; extra components set the lateral axes for extruded profiles. For a 2-D domain the stream vector may have 2 components.

parameterdescription.para: The field to track the streamline along.

simplesect.para: Status CMLibs::Zinc::OK on success, otherwise CMLibs::Zinc::ERROR_ARGUMENT.

detaileddescription.para: Gets the direction in which streamlines are tracked.

simplesect.para: The current tracking direction, or INVALID on error.

detaileddescription.para:
Sets the direction in which streamlines are tracked relative to the stream vector field.
GraphicsStreamlines::TrackDirection
trackDirection
The new tracking direction.
Status CMLibs::Zinc::OK on success, otherwise CMLibs::Zinc::ERROR_ARGUMENT.
Gets the maximum length of time streamlines are tracked along.

simplesect.para: The track length/time, or 0.0 if invalid streamlines graphics.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the maximum length of time to track streamlines along. Default value is 1.0; generally need to adjust this for time scale of model as streamlines can be slow to evaluate.

parameterdescription.para: The maximum length of time to track streamlines along >= 0.

simplesect.para: Status CMLibs::Zinc::OK on success, otherwise CMLibs::Zinc::ERROR_ARGUMENT.

briefdescription.para: Streamlines visualise the path of a fluid particle tracking along a vector field.

detaileddescription.para:
Streamlines visualise the path of a fluid particle tracking along a vector field. 2-D and 3-D mesh domains are supported. Seed points for streamlines are sampled from elements according to the graphics sampling attributes and tessellation. Streamlines are drawn as lines, scalable ribbons or extruded circles or squares, as specified by the graphics line attributes. The curl of the stream vector field, or fibre sheet and normal, are visualised by the rotation or lateral orientation of the streamline when viewed with non-line shapes.
Graphicssamplingattributes
Graphicslineattributes
